trans-unit.source: Sign in to your Azure subscription using the steps listed in <linkText>Connect to Azure from the Azure CLI</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to your Azure subscription using the steps listed in <linkText>Connect to Azure from the Azure CLI</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Make sure you are in the Service Management mode by using:
trans-unit.target: Make sure you are in the Service Management mode by using:

trans-unit.source: Find out the Linux image that you want to load from the available images:
trans-unit.target: Find out the Linux image that you want to load from the available images:

trans-unit.source: Use azure vm create to create a new virtual machine with the Linux image from the above list.
trans-unit.target: Use azure vm create to create a new virtual machine with the Linux image from the above list.

trans-unit.source: This step creates a new cloud service as well as a new storage account.
trans-unit.target: This step creates a new cloud service as well as a new storage account.

trans-unit.source: You could also connect this virtual machine to an existing cloud service with a -c option.
trans-unit.target: You could also connect this virtual machine to an existing cloud service with a -c option.

trans-unit.source: It also creates an SSH endpoint to login to the Linux virtual machine with the -e option.
trans-unit.target: It also creates an SSH endpoint to login to the Linux virtual machine with the -e option.

trans-unit.source: For a Linux virtual machine, you must provide the -e option in vm create; it is not possible to enable SSH after the virtual machine has been created.
trans-unit.target: For a Linux virtual machine, you must provide the -e option in vm create; it is not possible to enable SSH after the virtual machine has been created.

trans-unit.source: For more details on SSH, read <linkText>How to Use SSH with Linux on Azure</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details on SSH, read <linkText>How to Use SSH with Linux on Azure</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Note that the image b4590d9e3ed742e4a1d46e5424aa335e__suse-opensuse-13.1-20141216-x86-64 is the one we chose from the image list in the above step.
trans-unit.target: Note that the image b4590d9e3ed742e4a1d46e5424aa335e__suse-opensuse-13.1-20141216-x86-64 is the one we chose from the image list in the above step.

trans-unit.source: MyTestVM is the name of our new virtual machine, and adminUser is the username that we will use to SSH into the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: MyTestVM is the name of our new virtual machine, and adminUser is the username that we will use to SSH into the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: You can replace these variables as per your requirement.
trans-unit.target: You can replace these variables as per your requirement.

trans-unit.source: For more details on this command, visit the <linkText>Using the Azure CLI with Azure Service Management</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details on this command, visit the <linkText>Using the Azure CLI with Azure Service Management</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The newly created Linux virtual machine will appear in the list given by:
trans-unit.target: The newly created Linux virtual machine will appear in the list given by:

trans-unit.source: You can verify the attributes of the virtual machine by using the command:
trans-unit.target: You can verify the attributes of the virtual machine by using the command:

trans-unit.source: The newly created virtual machine is ready to start with the azure vm start command.
trans-unit.target: The newly created virtual machine is ready to start with the azure vm start command.

trans-unit.source: For details on all these Azure CLI virtual machine commands, please read the <linkText>Using the Azure CLI with the Service Management API</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For details on all these Azure CLI virtual machine commands, please read the <linkText>Using the Azure CLI with the Service Management API</linkText><title></title>.
